robot_capabilities.duneRunner: A robot that can lift the car and stabilize it while the wheels are being changed. It can work together with other robots.
robot_capabilities.aquaRover: A robot that can lift the car and stabilize it while the wheels are being changed. It can work together with other robots.
robot_capabilities.shoreHauler: A robot that as an robotic arm in whch ut can carry the whhels, also it can remove the old wheels and place the new ones.

robot_morphology.duneRunner: Speed: 0–3.5 m/s, Weight: 45 kg, Size: 800 × 400 × 550 mm, Wheelbase: Stabilized, Lifting Mechanism: Hydraulic jack (~800 kg), Arm Reach: 500 mm
robot_morphology.aquaRover: Speed: 0–2.5 m/s, Weight: 30 kg, Size: 400 × 350 × 200 mm, Lifting Pad: Pneumatic assist (~800 kg), Arm Reach: 400 mm, Tool Compatibility: Socket wrench, Stabilizer: Yes
robot_morphology.shoreHauler: Speed: 0–2 m/s, Weight: 30 kg, Size: 1000 × 600 × 500 mm, Tire Rack Capacity: 2 wheels, Arm Reach: 400 mm, Tool: Automated wheel gripper

task_specific_rules: An average car wheel weighs around 20 kg and has a diameter of 600 mm.
An average car wighs around 1500 kg and has a wheelbase of 2500 mm.
It is better to lift the whole car up when it is to change ALL the wheels
remeber to put the car down at the end of the task only if needed
